result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Hillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd M Hillman

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM Defendant Todd M Hillman in court in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared by video for Todd M Hillman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CM328, 22CF293, 22CF361

21CM328 is set for a sentencing after revocation hearing. Agent is recommending 9 months jail.
22CF293, 22CF361 are Branch 2 cases that have resolved with a global resolution. 

Atty Lundeen - plea to Ct 1 22CF293 - 65 days jail credit for time served. costs of $538.00.  22CF361 dismissed. Will argue sentence on 21CM328. 
State - that is the agreement.   DE - understands agreement
Court - provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters Guilty plea to Ct 1 22CF293.
Parties stipulate to the facts
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty of 22CF293.
State - asks court to accept joint recommendation in 22CF293, 22CF361. Argues sentence for 21CM328. Asks court to follow recommendations of agent.
Atty Lundeen - agrees court should accept joint recommendation in 22CF293, 22CF361. Argues sentence for 21CM328. Asks court to order 60 days jail with credit for 65 days served.    DE - makes a statement to the court.   

Court orders -
22CF293 
60 days jail -  
credit for 65 days - time served
Costs of $538.00

22CF361 - dismissed

21CM328
Count 1 -
6 months jail
credit for 65 days
